Please stop spreading dumb ideas like "what fuels conflict is the opposite of altruism: self-interest". Where in the whole of psychology have you read that? Self-interest doesn't result in getting something at the expense of someone else. In fact in the vast majority of the cases it results in getting something while the other party benefits as well. Think about all the things you buy every day. Think about your job. Almost everything that you do every day is out of self-interest with zero chance of conflict.

It's an interesting thing that in Lifeguard training, you are taught to specifically give bystanders tasks, essentially calling them out. Don't say "Someone call an ambulance", instead point to someone specifically and say "You, call an ambulance". It's almost a nullification of the bystander effect.

Perhaps not best for a Sci Show video, but in a vlogbrothers video have you considered discussing chronic and persistent mental disorders? Most disorders are a 'more off than on' sort of thing. A diagnosis of most mood disorders suggests periodic episodes with a return to a normal state, but personality disorders (and some mood disorders) are much more consistent, and need to be treated, mentally and therapeutically, much differently.

I have persistent depressive disorder, and I certainly don't benefit from the idea many depressions people can cling to: it will get better. I've been in a fairly good mood for the last several weeks, but I know that this will be followed by the return of months or years of depression. Rather than 'it will get better' I can't help but think 'it will get worse, and stay that way.'

When the police finally got there and asked why no one had called the cops, the summarized response was "We thought someone else would do it".

I can not answer the question wether true altruism does or does not exist. But I do know that when you say something can never selfless, that you probably misinterpreted the cause of our behaviour.
Our behaviour has evolved due to selection and adaptation. Likely, what we call altruism has evolved over the course of a long and complex road of the survival of the fittest. This survival counts on passing on genes that will code for neural structures that enable us to more likely be altruistic. Furthermore, we can only rely on the information that is available to us - thus we can not count on direct or even indirect reciprocal altruism at all times. Therefore true altruism (the act of doing something that reduces our own fitness to help that of the other) has the ability to survive as a fit behaviour. And thus true altruism can exist.
And in my opinion (according to anecdotal evidence such as life experience and introspection), it does exist.

This is Null-A (Non Aristotelian Logic.)
The map is not the Territory; the Word is not the thing it represents. Our sensations are not reality, but an abstraction from reality.
 
The laws of Men will never be just until they are sane.
 
Fear is the reaction of the living organism, not to threat, but to the perception of threat.
 
Analyzing the universe into simple binary opposites, while necessary, has limited value.
 
A multivalued logic is more accurately reflects the complexity of the universe. Such logic is call non-Aristotelian or Null-A.
 
Insanity is the confusion of symbol for object at a preconscious level.
 
When the symbol-to-object relation is false-to-facts, behaviors are maladaptive. When mind will not abandon useless behaviors, frustration is the result.
 
The function served by a tool can be inferred by its design.
 
Because we make artificial but necessary distinctions I speech and thought between various phenomena in the plenum, our habit is to ignore their fundamental unity.
 
Every identity is distinct. No matter their over similarity, one of any two objects is an individual.
 
Categorization, the mental act of treating individuals as identical members of a class, is an abstraction whose accuracy must be always open to question.
 
The general rule is that any notions of identity are simplifications of a more complex underlying reality; this rule applies to self-identification.
 
The advantage of non-Aristotelian integration over the stereotyped reflexes of categorical thought is greater flexibility of mental adjustment of abstractions to the facts they represent.
 
Once the mind and body are conditioned, at a pre-verbal level, to operate beyond the assumptions of Aristotelian categories, and to be aware of the self-reflexive nature of abstraction, then the mind ids ready to adapt itself to reality as it is, not as we wish it were.
 
It is important to remember that there is a wide, perhaps limitless, number of mechanisms, social and psychological, the human nervous system can adopt when dealing with the surrounding universe.
 
A memory is an abstraction from reality and, as such, is not accurate. Always keep in mind that the nervous system records not sense-impressions but our reactions to and interpretations of them.
 
Time and space appear to our nervous system to be separate, although science shows these are two aspects of one underlying reality.
 
Paradox is a sign of the failure of the model used to perceive, that is, to adduce meaning. Failure occurs when one or more false assumptions involved pass unquestioned.
 
“Category” confusion in an organism is caused by the attempt of the nervous system to identify one object, process, or event as another; neurosis is the rejection of all evidence to the contrary. The purpose of non-Aristotelian logic is to avoid such errors of categorization
 
The process of scientific thought consist of increasingly less inaccurate predictive models based on observation. When the model is not subject to change due to further observations, it is no longer scientific.
 
No two objects in the universe, no two events, are identical.
 
The human nervous system is limited in its capacity to draw meaningful distinctions and therefore must treat similar objects as if they are identical: This is always done with reference to some purpose.
 
Human abstraction therefore is conditioned by environment: We make those distinctions and see those similarities useful to our though process. In novel environment, those unconscious, automatic habits of assumption will no longer be accurate.
 
Higher order abstractions are a perfected type of memory—that is, information that preserves itself with minimal distortion within a continuum.
 
Every model of the universe, being an abstraction, is inaccurate: The process itself of modeling creates structural barriers to the comprehension.


 
In nature, the composition of a phenomenon is known by its observed behavior: Where the behavior shows consistency, a correct abstract model can be formed for events of those types, but the abstraction is limited to those types.
 
The process of false identification takes place at a subconscious level: With proper training, the mind can be made aware of these subliminal processes and subject them to human, as opposed to animal, abstraction.
 
Emotion, like all neural “identification” actions, operates by means of approximations. In simpler animals, the approximations are cruder: An amoeba need only distinguish between food-objects and threat-objects. The purpose of Null-A training is to refine simplistic animal identifications.
 
In multivalued logic, categories of thought assumed in classical logic to be absolute, such as essence and accident, time and space, cause and effect, are subordinated to a flexible system of approximations.
 
The test of the accuracy of approximations about reality is simply the lack of surprise in the nervous system trained to assume them.
 
Positive judgments, that the world should and must conform to a man-made world-view, are the source of violence neurosis of mankind, for the absolutism of two such positive judgment systems clashing leaves no room for peaceful arbitration.
 
Scientific thought is based on negative judgment: Reality disqualifies any scientific, model found guilty of inaccurate prediction. Hence negative judgment demands that the man-made world-view should and must conform to the world.
 
Negative judgment is the peak of mentality.
 
To think is to abstract.
 
Memory is identity.
 
When the symbols an organisms uses to grasp and manipulate reality are false-to-facts, this is call a semantic disturbance. Sanity is approached by checking symbols against their referents. Neurosis results from the attempt to protect false-to-facts associations from criticism.
 
Every assumption contains an element of falsehood. Nevertheless, if the assumptions made retain a general structure similarly to reality, they can be used.
 
When information enters the nervous system, it creates entropy outside the system, and therefore memory operates in the direction of increasing entropy, the direction we call future. On the fine level, these distinctions are proven to be artificial.
 
The perception of time is a categorical perception that identifies the plenum of events as broken as into cause and effect.
 
Space is a categorical perception of extension, and time of duration. General Relativity, the earliest of non-Aristotelian scientific systems, demonstrated that these categories are partial misperceptions of an underlying single entity: space-time.
 
The adjustment of the mind to the needs and conditions of reality has both an intellectual and emotional component. The adjustment of the intellect to reality is science; the adjustment of emotions is sanity.
 
The psychological sense of certainty with a belief is held is no guarantee of its accuracy and may interfere with attempts to correct it based on new information.
 
Common sense, do what it will, cannot avoid being surprised occasionally. The object of science is to spare it this emotion and create mental habits that shall be in such close accord with the habits of the world as to secure that nothing shall be unexpected.
 
-Bertrand Russell

Doesn't Capitalism (to a degree) encourage or result in an ever-increasing likelihood of social traps? Ultimately individuals, or individuals cooperating towards a shared objective, will make decisions that compromise the whole of society/humanity to further their singular/limited interests. You hear of this sort of thinking all the time: the steel company wants to dump waste into Lake Michigan because IT needs a place to dispose of it (despite the fact that this would harm millions of other people); the coal company in Kentucky wants to stripmine entire swaths of hills, despite the devastating legacy costs to the surrounding environment and population; and the chemical company wants to emit pollutants into the air in Texas because it would be the easiest (and cheapest) means of releasing industrial byproduct (even though this will cause acid rain and contaminate the water supply). Oh, and in this paradigm the conflicting parties are not big industry vs environmentalist, but rather big industry entity vs other big industry entity....both ultimately harming others in their competition for increased profits (for themselves) with minimized costs (to themselves).

It's interesting that although resources were mentioned as a key factor in conflict theory in the beginning, it was completely ignored throughout the rest of the video. The thing is, if members of a community realize that there is enough resources for all of them in the environment they live in, it simply makes no sense to compete with each other (game theory).
This is the case with Earth today - with modern levels of productivity (aided by machines and robots), there is enough resources for everyone to have access to food, clean water and shelter (FAO, 2002), but the problem is that A) most people don't know this, and that B) they don't view humanity as one big family. And this leads to competition, commerce, and war.

It always amazes me that "researchers" can do studies of aggression with samples of half the population--males--and say that "people" are like this.  If they had used two groups of young women, I suspect that their initial results would have been different.  Testosterone always leads males to seek out who is Alpha--stags, male lions, gorillas, and human males.  Estrogen is the "let's all find a way to get along" hormone.  Two groups of girls might have developed a verbal rivalry--or not--but I doubt they would have burst into fisticuffs or hair-pulling, probably not even shouting.  Unless this experiment is repeated with groups of girls, there should be no conclusions about "human" behavior, merely male behavior.   Girls would have been just as likely to have sought out common ground from the get-go, perhaps not needing the artificial "let's do this together" tasks the boys needed to be guided into.  O Vanity, thy name is patriarchy.

The way I see it, there is no such thing as selflessness, just a redefinition of the "self". In the grand scheme of things every human is virtually identical therefore protecting other humans is like protecting yourself. People don't just use their genetics to define the self either, they use their psychology, or "memetics". Protecting someone with similar beliefs as you is also like protecting yourself.

Consider the following. You will die in two days and humanity will go extinct just moments later. You have the option of saving humanity, but you will die in 5 minutes. Obviously a day is better than 5 minutes and it shouldn't matter to you what happens to the universe after you are dead, so why would anyone choose the second option? Because there is an afterlife, a real afterlife that exists through the shared genes, memes, and causal interactions you have with humanity. If humanity went extinct then every trace of you will be erased from the universe, like burning down Heaven. You will have died more when humanity went extinct then when your heart stopped beating.

It makes sense to be altruistic. We are all in this together.

This is where words get twisted; altruism gets confused with 'doing good for others' while rational self interest (selfishness, literally) is seen as hording stuff and ignoring everyone else. This is where I part ways with this video; why is self interest a precursor to conflict necessarily while collectivism is somehow that which leads to peace? How do you create peace when you have a system that literally is backed up by threats of force and controls whoever failed to win enough elections? I don't see collectivism as peaceful at all. Rational self interest is the way to peace; do not control others. 

If you help others, you are being selfish, yes, but not in the way that most people mean it in everyday speech. You are being 'selfish' because helping someone else is in YOUR SELF INTEREST. It doesn't take away ANY moral points however. Helping others should be in your self interest and therefore SELFISH, without the derogatory or stigma behind the word.

The opposite of altruistic behavior is not aggression, it is anti-social behavior.  One can use aggression to defend others without hope or thought of personal reward. 

Aggression is instead better defined as one of the extremes of behavior resulting from the fight or flight response--people only get ugly when they are uncomfortable or feel threatened, and respond aggressively only when they attribute the source of that discomfiture to the willful act of another individual or group whose behaviors or schemas they deem threatening or detrimental to such social organizations through which the individual perceives as a defining schema of the self.
